page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: The area is situated in North Yorkshire to the west of the Hambleton Hills.Most of the land is used for farming and forestry. Nearly half of the area is enclosed by the North Yorkshire Moors National Park. The village of Sutton under Whitestonecliffe occupies the north west corner. Most of the inhabitants of the village commute to their employment. In the remainder of the area most own or are employed on the local farms. The small market town of Thirsk lies three miles west of the village and provides amenities such as supermarkets, banks,public baths and comprehensive school.The only public transport from the village is a bus to the market in Thirsk once a week.
